# Acquisition Framework

## Purpose

Get new users through sustainable, scalable channels. Acquisition without retention is a leaky bucketâ€”but you still need users.

---

## Channel Categories

### Owned Channels

| Channel | What | Solo-Friendly |
|---------|------|---------------|
| Website/SEO | Organic search traffic | Yes |
| Blog/Content | Content marketing | Yes |
| Email list | Newsletter, sequences | Yes |
| Social profiles | Twitter, LinkedIn | Yes |

### Earned Channels

| Channel | What | Solo-Friendly |
|---------|------|---------------|
| Word of mouth | Users tell others | Yes |
| Press/PR | Media coverage | Medium |
| Reviews | G2, Capterra | Yes |
| Communities | Reddit, Discord | Yes |

### Paid Channels

| Channel | What | Solo-Friendly |
|---------|------|---------------|
| Google Ads | Search ads | Low (expensive) |
| Social ads | FB, Twitter ads | Low |
| Sponsorships | Newsletter, podcast | Medium |
| Affiliates | Revenue share | Medium |

---

## Solo Builder Channel Strategy

### Recommended Priority

**Tier 1 (Focus here first):**
1. Content/SEO - Long-term sustainable
2. Communities - Direct access to users
3. Social presence - Build audience

**Tier 2 (Add when T1 working):**
4. Email marketing - Convert audience
5. Partnerships - Leverage others' audiences
6. Referrals - Leverage users

**Tier 3 (Only if profitable):**
7. Paid acquisition - Requires capital

### Channel Selection Matrix

| Factor | Weight It |
|--------|-----------|
| Where are users now? | High |
| Can you sustain effort? | High |
| Does it match your skills? | High |
| Time to results? | Medium |
| Scalability? | Low (worry later) |

---

## Content/SEO Strategy

### Why Content Works for Solo

- Free (costs time, not money)
- Compounds over time
- Builds authority
- Attracts qualified traffic

### Content Types by Funnel

| Funnel Stage | Content Type | Example |
|--------------|--------------|---------|
| Awareness | Problem content | "Why X is hard" |
| Interest | Solution content | "How to solve X" |
| Consideration | Comparison | "X vs Y for Z" |
| Decision | Product content | "How [Product] works" |

### SEO Basics

**Keyword Research:**
```
"{problem} solution"
"how to {solve problem}"
"best {product type}"
"{competitor} alternative"
"{industry} tools"
```

**On-Page:**
- Target one keyword per page
- Keyword in title, H1, URL
- Answer the search intent
- Internal linking

**Content Calendar:**
- Start with 1 post/week
- Focus on consistency
- Build around keywords

---

## Community Strategy

### Finding Communities

| Platform | Find Via |
|----------|----------|
| Reddit | Search subreddits |
| Discord | Disboard, Google |
| Slack | Slofile, community lists |
| Twitter | Hashtags, lists |
| LinkedIn | Groups |

### Community Engagement

**Phase 1: Listen (2 weeks)**
- Join and observe
- Understand culture
- Note common questions

**Phase 2: Contribute (ongoing)**
- Answer questions helpfully
- Share insights (not product)
- Build reputation

**Phase 3: Share (carefully)**
- Share when relevant
- Always disclose affiliation
- Focus on helping

### Reddit Strategy

**Good posts:**
```
"I built X to solve Y - looking for feedback"
"Lessons learned building X"
"How I solved Y (happens to use my tool)"
```

**Bad posts:**
```
"Check out my new app!"
"Use this tool for Y"
Anything without context
```

---

## Social Media Strategy

### Platform Selection

| Platform | Best For | Effort |
|----------|----------|--------|
| Twitter/X | Tech, B2B, builders | Medium |
| LinkedIn | B2B, professional | Medium |
| TikTok | B2C, visual | High |
| YouTube | Tutorials, demos | High |
| Instagram | B2C, visual | Medium |

### Twitter/X for Solo Builders

**Content mix:**
- 40% Value (tips, insights)
- 30% Personal (journey, learnings)
- 20% Product (features, updates)
- 10% Engagement (replies, RTs)

**Growth tactics:**
- Consistent posting (1-3x/day)
- Reply to bigger accounts
- Join conversations
- Share building journey

---

## Email Marketing

### List Building

**Capture mechanisms:**
- Lead magnet (template, guide)
- Newsletter signup
- Free tool/calculator
- Waitlist
- Content upgrades

### Email Sequences

**Welcome sequence:**
1. Welcome + quick win
2. Core value delivery
3. Social proof
4. Feature highlight
5. Soft pitch

**Engagement sequence:**
- Weekly newsletter
- Product updates
- Tips and tricks

---

## Referral Strategy

### When to Add Referrals

**Prerequisites:**
- Product is good (NPS > 30)
- Users naturally share
- You can fulfill demand

### Referral Mechanics

| Type | How | Example |
|------|-----|---------|
| One-sided | Referrer gets reward | "$10 credit per referral" |
| Two-sided | Both get reward | "You both get 1 month free" |
| Tiered | More referrals = more | "5 referrals = premium" |

### Referral Program Design

```
Reward: {What they get}
Trigger: {When to ask}
Mechanism: {How they share}
Tracking: {How you track}
```

---

## CAC & Unit Economics

### Calculating CAC

```
CAC = Total Acquisition Cost / New Customers

Include:
- Ad spend
- Content creation time
- Tool costs
- Your time value
```

### CAC/LTV Ratio

| Ratio | Meaning |
|-------|---------|
| < 1:1 | Losing money |
| 1:1 - 1:3 | Break even to OK |
| 1:3+ | Healthy |
| 1:5+ | Very healthy |

### Payback Period

```
Payback = CAC / Monthly revenue per customer
```

**Target:** < 12 months for SaaS

---

## Channel Testing

### Test Framework

```
1. Hypothesis: {channel} will bring {X users} at {$Y CAC}
2. Test budget: ${Z} or {N hours}
3. Test duration: {X weeks}
4. Success metric: {what defines success}
```

### Channel Test Sizing

| Stage | Test Budget | Duration |
|-------|-------------|----------|
| Initial | $0 or 10 hours | 2 weeks |
| Validation | $100 or 20 hours | 4 weeks |
| Scale | $500+ | Ongoing |

---

## Metrics to Track

### Per Channel

| Metric | Why |
|--------|-----|
| Traffic | Volume |
| Sign-up rate | Quality |
| Activation rate | Fit |
| CAC | Efficiency |
| Payback | Sustainability |

### Overall Acquisition

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| Visitors | {X}/month |
| Sign-ups | {X}/month |
| Conversion | {X}% |
| CAC | <${X} |
